category: National Sports Festival Regulations/Article 30 (Events of the National Sports Festival)
contents: Article 30 (Events of the National Life Sports Festival) ① The official events of the National Life Sports Festival are determined in accordance with the following items. Revised on January 24, 2022. 1. A sport for which 10 or more member city/provincial sports associations have been formed. However, even for sports for which less than 10 member city/province sports associations have been formed, sports that are deemed particularly necessary for revitalizing lifestyle sports may be made official sports. 2. Among the events included in subparagraph 1, any of the following events may be excluded or adjusted from the National Sports Festival until normalization. go. Among the sports in which more than 10 city/province sports organizations are formed in the main text of subparagraph 1, when there are not more than 8 cities/provinces that have participated for more than 2 years B. B. In each division of the sport, it is necessary to adjust the division as more than 1/2 of the cities and provinces have not participated for more than 2 years. Events that have caused accidents or scandals for more than two consecutive years during the competition period ② Demonstration events for the National Life Sports Festival are determined as follows. Revised 2022. 1. 24. 1. If it is the first time to participate in the National Life Sports Festival by newly joining the Sports Association as a member organization, and there is a need to undergo verification for operation of the game for more than 1 year but less than 2 years 2. Join the Sports Association Among one member sport organization, the member city/provincial sports associations account for more than 1/2 to less than 2/3 of all cities/provinces and wish to participate in the National Life Sports Festival to revitalize the sport. 3. Member city/provincial sports associations participating in the competition. A request is made to the Sports Council to hold it as a demonstration event in order to revitalize a specific event, or an event that the Sports Council deems necessary. 4. Events that fall under subparagraph 2 of paragraph 1 shall be held as demonstration events until normalization by reorganizing the competition for each event. Do this.
